chapter-18_key2: Move the mouse to the top-left corner of the screen, that is, the (0, 0) coordinates.
chapter-18_key3: pyautogui.size() returns a tuple with two integers for the width and height of the screen.
chapter-18_key4: pyautogui.position() returns a tuple with two integers for the x- and y-coordinates of the mouse cursor.
chapter-18_key5: The moveTo() function moves the mouse to absolute coordinates on the screen, while the moveRel() function moves the mouse relative to the mouseâ€™s current position.
chapter-18_key8: Either pass a list of keyboard key strings to pyautogui.typewrite() (such as 'left') or pass a single keyboard key string to pyautogui.press().
